Article CARDINAL of the royal decree prescribes , inter alia , the content of the declarations referred to above , for example , they must contain a brief description of the subject matter of the contract , the type and the terms and conditions of transfer , the names , addresses and signatures of the contracting parties and an indication of the date and place in GPE at which the property sold shall be delivered to the purchaser . Under that provision , a declaration which does not contain all that information in full and precise terms shall be considered to be null and void .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law no . DATE prescribes a prison sentence of DATE and a maximum fine of ITL CARDINAL for , inter alia , failure to make the declaration prescribed by section CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . Lastly , sections CARDINAL et seq . of the royal decree govern expropriations of movable and immovable property and refer in a number of places to PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE relating to expropriations in the public interest . In that context LAW provides that a public - interest declaration is made by ORG after ORG ( Consiglio superiore per l'antichità e le belle arti ) has given its approval and observations have been received from the PERSON .

CARDINAL . LAW and Preventing the Illicit Import , Export and Transfer of Ownership of Cultural Property was signed in GPE on DATE and came into force on DATE ( in GPE on DATE ) . Article CARDINAL provides :
“ The States Parties to this Convention recognise that for the purpose of the Convention property which belongs to the following categories forms part of the cultural heritage of each State :

( a ) cultural property created by the individual or collective genius of nationals of the ORG concerned , and cultural property of importance to the ORG concerned created within the territory of that ORG by foreign nationals or stateless persons resident within such territory ;
( b ) cultural property found within the national territory ;
( c ) cultural property acquired by archaeological , ethnological or natural science missions , with the consent of the competent authorities of the country of origin of such property ;
( d ) cultural property which has been the subject of a freely agreed exchange ;
( e ) cultural property received as a gift or purchased legally with the consent of the competent authorities of the country of origin of such property . ”

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON applied to ORG on DATE . He complained that there had been a violation of LAW No . CARDINAL and of ORG DATE on the ground that ORG had exercised a right of pre - emption over a PERSON painting which , he alleged , he had lawfully purchased .
CARDINAL . The Commission declared the application ( no . CARDINAL ) admissible on DATE . In its report of CARDINAL DATE ( former LAW ) , it expressed the opinion
( a ) that there had not been a violation of LAW No . CARDINAL ( CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL ) ;
( b ) that there had not been a violation of LAW ( CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL ) ; and
( c ) that there had not been a violation of LAW ( unanimously ) .
